org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.primer

Enum OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator>
      • org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.primer.OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator>

    public enum OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator
extends Enum<OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator>
    Includes several algorithms that compute the optimal melting temperature (Tm) for a primer sequence. Melting Temperature is when half of the DNA dissociates and becomes single stranded.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ALLAWI_SANTALUCIA
      Computes the optimal melting temperature using an improved nearest-neighbor version of Freier et al using updated transition tables as described Allawi, H.
      BRESLAUR
      Computes the optimal temperature using the nearest neighbor algorithm as described by Freier et al using the Breslaur 1986 transition tables.
      MARMUR
      Use the Marmur formaula which only takes into account the number of GC and AT nucleotides.
      SANTALUCIA_1996
      Computes the optimal melting temperature using transition tables derived from John SantaLucia, Jr., Hatim T.
      SANTALUCIA_1998
      Computes the optimal melting temperature using an the same transition tables as ALLAWI_SANTALUCIA (now calling this "unified" transition tables) but uses a modified initiation parameters for terminal G*C and terminal A*T pairs.
      SUGIMOTO
      Computes the optimal melting temperature using an improved nearest-neighbor version of Freier et al using updated transition tables as described by Sugimoto et all.
      WALLACE
      Use the Wallace et al.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • MARMUR

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator MARMUR
        Use the Marmur formaula which only takes into account the number of GC and AT nucleotides. The positions of the nucleotides is does not matter. This is the simplest estimation and is not recommended for large primers.
        See Also:
        Marmur J and Doty P (1962) J Mol Biol 5:109-118; PMID 14470099

      • WALLACE

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator WALLACE
        Use the Wallace et al. formula which only takes into account the number of A,C,G and T nucleotides. The positions of the nucleotides is does not matter. This estimation and is not recommended for large primers.
        See Also:
        RB Wallace, et al. Nucleic Acids Res. 1979;6:3543.

      • BRESLAUR

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator BRESLAUR
        Computes the optimal temperature using the nearest neighbor algorithm as described by Freier et al using the Breslaur 1986 transition tables. This is the same algorithm (if you add salt correction) that primer3 uses.
        See Also:
        Breslauer KJ et al. Predicting DNA duplex stability from the base sequence. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1986 Jun;83(11):3746-50; PMID 3459152, Freier SM et al Improved free-energy parameters for predictions of RNA duplex stability. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1986 Dec;83(24):9373-7.

      • ALLAWI_SANTALUCIA

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator ALLAWI_SANTALUCIA
        Computes the optimal melting temperature using an improved nearest-neighbor version of Freier et al using updated transition tables as described Allawi, H. T. & SantaLucia, J., Jr. (1997), "Thermodynamics and NMR of Internal G-T Mismatches in DNA", Biochemistry 36, 10581-10594.

      • SANTALUCIA_1998

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator SANTALUCIA_1998
        Computes the optimal melting temperature using an the same transition tables as ALLAWI_SANTALUCIA (now calling this "unified" transition tables) but uses a modified initiation parameters for terminal G*C and terminal A*T pairs.
        See Also:
        J J SantaLucia. A unified view of polymer, dumbbell, and oligonucleotide DNA nearest-neighbor thermodynamics. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 95(4):1460-5 (1998), PMID 9465037

      • SANTALUCIA_1996

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator SANTALUCIA_1996
        Computes the optimal melting temperature using transition tables derived from John SantaLucia, Jr., Hatim T. Allawi, and P. Ananda Seneviratne. Improved Nearest-Neighbor Parameters for Predicting DNA Duplex Stability. Biochemistry 1996, 35, 3555-3562.
        See Also:
        SantaLucia J Jr, Allawi HT, Seneviratne PA. Improved nearest-neighbor parameters for predicting DNA duplex stability. Biochemistry. 1996 Mar 19;35(11):3555-62; PMID 8639506

      • SUGIMOTO

        public static final OptimalMeltingTemperatureEstimator SUGIMOTO
        Computes the optimal melting temperature using an improved nearest-neighbor version of Freier et al using updated transition tables as described by Sugimoto et all.
        See Also:
        Naoki Sugimoto, Shu-ich Nakano, Mari Yoneyama and Kei-ich Honda. Improved thermodynamic parameters and helix initiation factor to predict stability of DNA duplexes. Nucleic Acids Research. 1996 Vol. 24. No. 22 4501-4505; PMCID: PMC146261

      • estimateTm

        public abstract double estimateTm(NucleotideSequence sequence,
                                  double nM)
        Estimate the optimal melting temperature in degrees Celsius for the given NucleotideSequence and concentration.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the NucleotideSequence to compute; can only have the nucleotides ACG and T.
        nM - the DNA concentration in nM.
        Returns:
        the temperature as a double.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if sequence contains any bases other than ACG and T.
        IllegalArgumentException - if nM is negative.

        protected boolean hasGorC(NucleotideSequence sequence)
